tit.e: Ko-zoku Gunjin (the Military from Imperial Family)
Ko-zoku Gunjin (the Military from Imperial Family)
Ko-zoku Gunjin (the Military from Imperial Family)

sen.j: 皇族軍人（こうぞくぐんじん）とは、大日本帝国陸軍・海軍の将官となった皇族を指す。
sen.e: Ko-zoku Gunjin means the member of imperial family who becomes general officer of Imperial Japanese Army or Imperial Japanese Navy.
sen.cmt: 原文の「大日本帝国」が重複→原文参照（http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9A%87%E6%97%8F%E8%BB%8D%E4%BA%BA）
sen.e: Ko-zoku Gunjin refer to the members of the imperial family who became general officers of the Imperial Japanese Army or Imperial Japanese Navy.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示を削除しました。表現を修正しました
sen.e: Ko-zoku Gunjin refer to the members of the imperial family who became general officers of the Imperial Japanese Army or Imperial Japanese Navy.

sen.j: 大日本帝国憲法下においては、天皇は大日本帝国陸海軍の大元帥として統括する立場にあった。
sen.e: According to the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, the Emperor was in a position to supervise Imperial Japanese Army and Navy as Generalissimo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 「大元帥」：http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E5%85%83%E5%B8%A5ただし、信憑性に疑問がありますので用語共有には登録していません
sen.e: According to the Meiji Constitution (Constitution of the Empire of Japan), the Emperor was in the position to supervise the Imperial Japanese Army and Navy as Daigensui (Commander-in-chief).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました。なお、generalissimoはクーデターによる軍事政権の最高司令官をほのめかす語でもあるようですので、言い換えました。参考：[1] http://eudict.com/?word=%E5%A4%A7%E5%85%83%E5%B8%A5&go=Search&lang=jpkeng [2] http://eow.alc.co.jp/generalissimo/UTF-8/
sen.e: According to the Meiji Constitution (Constitution of the Empire of Japan), the Emperor was in the position to supervise the Imperial Japanese Army and Navy as Daigensui (Commander-in-chief).

sen.j: 皇太子は成人ないしはそれに見合う年齢になったとされると将官に任じられる。
sen.e: Crown prince was appointed as a general officer when he was regarded that he became an adult or his age is enough as an adult.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Crown Prince was appointed as a general officer when he came of age or was regarded so.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: The Crown Prince was appointed as a general officer when he came of age or was regarded so.
